title: Field extension
summary:
In mathematics, particularly in algebra, a field extension is a pair of fields 
  
    
      
        E
        âŠ†
        F
        ,
      
    
    {\displaystyle E\subseteq F,}
  
 such that the operations of E are those of F restricted to E. In this case, F is an extension field of E and E is a subfield of F.[1][2][3] For example, under the usual notions of addition and multiplication, the complex numbers are an extension field of the real numbers; the real numbers are a subfield of the complex numbers.
